snippet: Every four years, the Navy requires its pilots to renew their skills in escaping from downed aircraft or surviving an ejection and parachute descent in an immersion course that is simultaneously appreciated and loathed.
abstract: United States Navy requires its pilots and those who fly with them to renew their skills in escaping from a downed aircraft or surviving an ejection and parachute descent by participating in a two-day immersion course every four years that is simultaneously appreciated and loathed.
lead_paragraph: Every four years, the Navy requires its pilots to renew their skills in escaping from downed aircraft or surviving an ejection and parachute descent in an immersion course that is simultaneously appreciated and loathed.
